page.title: 06Conservation in Charnwood
page.content: The Leics and Rutland Trust for Nature Conservation owns and manages 120acres accessible only to members in the upper part of Ulverscroft valley in an area of 1)oakwood & bracken with birch holly,rowan & bilberry 2)birch scrub 3)mixed woodland with sweet chestnut, larch,spruce,bluebells & foxgloves 4) beechwood with an understorey of holly 5)marsh with kingcups & marsh thistle 6)old pasture reverting to scrub with gorse furze & heather.Another 19 acres at Broombriggs S of the Beacon is part of an estate given to Leics CC and the subject of an access and management agreement between Leics CC and the LRTNC.It consists of a large field with typical Charnwood boundaries hawthorn,holly & oak to the E and a stone wall with mountain ash and gorse to the W.There are also 2 small spinneys of mixed woodland.
